subject: Re: JUnit 3.8.1, JDK 1.4.1 and RedHat 8.0 -> TextRunnerTest failure
msgSnippet: ... being a little more specific.  Why could the textui not run ... error?  Same for the swingui.  About the failed ... Dave? ... Starting from the command
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Jason Rogers <jacaetevha@f...> wrote:
> How about

being a little more specific. Why could the textui not run
> anything? What's the

error? Same for the swingui. About the failed
> test I have no clue. Vladimir? J.B.?

Dave?
>
> =jason
>

Starting from the command line, in the junit
directory,
java
junit.swingui.TestRunner
junit.samples.money.MoneyTest
runs and shows a
completely green
bar.

Similarly,
java junit.swingui.TestRunner

junit.samples.VectorTest
runs and shows a completely green

bar.

However:
java junit.textui.TestRunner

junit.samples.money.MoneyTest
returns:
Class not found

"junit.samples.money.MoneyTest"

and
java junit.textui.TestRunner

junit.samples.VectorTest
returns:
Class not found

"junit.samples.VectorTest"

In fact, calling the textui on any class "foo"

results in the message:
Class not found "foo"

So I am confident that JUnit can run

with the swing ui, but not
with the text ui.

Further, when I run java

junit.swingui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests
the ui pops up and shows a

green bar for the first 98 runs. And then,
on the 99th run, the bar turns red.

The

Failures window

shows:
testSuccess(junit.tests.runner.TextRunnerTest)

The Test
Hierarchy
tab shows a tree, expanded to show

folder:
junit.tests.runner.TextRunnerTest

below which there is a green
check
next to "testError"
and black X next to "testSuccess"

The lowest window

shows:
junit.framework.AssertionFailedError
at

junit.tests.runner.TextRunnerTest.execTest(TextRunnerTest.java:37)
at

junit.tests.runner.TextRunnerTest.testSuccess(TextRunnerTest.java:20)

etc.

The

line 20 command in the source file is a call to execTest().

The line 37 command is an

assertTrue() call.

I note what appears to be a system call to

junit.textui.TestRunner on line 31,
which is probably the origin of the

problem.

----
I hope the above is more helpful.
In short, it seems that textui must be

able to
run in order for the basic tests to run.
I have, of course, unzipped the

src.jar
and examined the source code, but
I cannot spot any obvious problems.

I

had hoped that this problem would
turn out to be something obvious, since
I had

assumed that JUnit 3.8.1 had been
tested extensively on Linux.

I wonder whether

JUnit has been tested with JDK 1.3,
but there are JDK 1.4
problems, possibly

specific to Redhat 8.0.
